document.docAuthor: Pešić, Vladimir, Smit, Harry & Gerecke, Reinhard
document.masterDocTitle: New records of water mites of the genus Atractides Koch, 1837 (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Hygrobatidae) from South Africa, with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New records of water mites of the genus Atractides Koch, 1837 (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Hygrobatidae) from South Africa, with descriptions of five new species

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6A–E .
Atractides latisetus (K. Viets, 1916)
, female, tributary of Sterkspruit River: A = idiosoma, ventral view; B = genital field, excretory pore and Vgl-1 and -2; C = palp, medial view; D = leg claw; E = I-L-5 and – 6. Scale bars = 100 μm.

FIGURE 7A–D .
Atractides linearis (Lundblad, 1927)
(A–C = male, D = female), Grobbelaars River: A = idiosoma, ventral view; B = I-L-5 and -6; C = palp, medial view; D = palp, lateral view. Scale bars = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. South Africa , Western Cape province: SA
9 25 / 24
/ 2 ( 1 / 1 / 1 mounted). KwaZulu-Natal province: SA

/0 ( 1 / 1 /0 mounted); SA 17 0/ 1 /0; SA 18 1 /0/0; SA 22 0/ 1 /0; SA

/0; DC 92 84 0/ 1 /0. Limpopo province: SA

/0. Mpumalanga province: DC 78 84 0/ 1 /0; DC 84
84 10 / 6
/0; DC 85 84 1 /0/0; DC 86 84 1 /0/0; DC 87
84 2 / 21
/0 ( 1 /0/0 mounted). Eastern Cape province: DC 103
84 4 / 28
/ 4 (0/0/ 1 mounted).

General features. Dorsal integument lineated; muscle attachments unsclerotized. Coxal field: apodemes Cx-II in an acute angle. Genital field: Ac in a weakly curved line. Excretory pore: unsclerotized; Vgl- 1 close to Vgl- 2 and often fused (in older specimens). Palp: sexual dimorphism, in both sexes P- 2 distoventrally protruding; P- 4 sword seta between ventral hairs, nearer to distoventral hair. I-L- 5 distally protruding near insertion S- 1 , S- 1 and S- 2 bluntly pointed, interspaced, S- 2 basally enlarged; I-L- 6 curved, inflated proximally, from the centre to the claw furrow with parallel dorsal and ventral margins; leg claw without dorsal clawlets.

Morphology. Male (SA 9 , in parentheses SA 12 , in square parentheses DC 87 84 ). Idiosoma L/W ( 423 )/( 328 ); glandularia maximum diameter 23 ( 19 ) [ 22 ]; coxal field L 288 [ 295 ]; Cx-III W 328 [ 347 ]; Cx-I+II mL 100 , lL 188 . Genital field (
Fig. 7 A
,
8 A
): anterior margin slightly concave; L/W 91 ( 97 ) [ 92 ]/ 102 ( 115 ) [ 99 ]; L Ac 1-3 : 24 ( 29– 32 ) [ 30 ], 28 ( 30–31 ) [ 29–32 ], 32 ( 38–39 ) [ 29 ]; ejaculatory complex L ( 103 ) [ 99 ].

FIGURE 9A–B .
Atractides linearis (Lundblad, 1927)
, female, Grobbelaars River: A = I-L-5 and -6; B = genital field. Scale bar = 100 μm.

FIGURE 10A–B .
Atractides linearis (Lundblad, 1927)
, deutonymph, Grobbelaars River: A = idiosoma, ventral view; B = I -L- 5 and -6. Scale bar = 100 μm.
